page.title:
NEUTRINO FACTORIES
NEUTRINO FACTORIES

Realization & Physics Potential
Realization & Physics Potential

Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 1

page.title:
Which Neutrino Measurements ?
Which Neutrino Measurements ?
page.normal_text:
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 3
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 3
page.enlisting:
• We don’t know exactly what we need to do to pin down the physics responsible for neutrino masses, but there is a broad consensus that the first steps for the accelerator-based neutrino program are: – Measure the unknown mixing angle q13 (is it non-zero) ? – Determine the pattern of neutrino masses (mass hierarchy) – Find or constrain CP violation in the neutrino sector • The less clear longer-term steps may involve finding more neutrino surprises, will probably involve guidance from other experimental results (LHC, CLV, neutrinoless bb …), & will almost certainly involve precision neutrino parameter measurements: – Do any of the parameters have special values ? – Suggestive relationships between parameters ? – Is 3 flavor mixing the whole story ? • We don’t know exactly what we need to do to pin
• We don’t know exactly what we need to do to pin
down the physics responsible for neutrino masses, but there is a broad consensus that the first steps for the accelerator-based neutrino program are: – Measure the unknown mixing angle q13 (is it non-zero) ? – Determine the pattern of neutrino masses (mass hierarchy) – Find or constrain CP violation in the neutrino sector

Beam Properties
Beam Properties

Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 6
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 6
page.enlisting:

page.title:
Key Experimental Signature
Key Experimental Signature
page.normal_text:
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 7
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 7
page.enlisting:
• Measuring the transitions ne  nm is crucial for the future neutrino oscillation program. • With a conventional neutrino beam this means measuring nm → ne oscillations, and hence ne appearance. With a NF we can measure ne → nm oscillations & hence ne appearance → very low backgrounds • Backgrounds to the detection of a wrong-sign muon are expected to be at the 10-4 level → background-free ne → nm oscillations with probabilities of O(10-4) can be measured ! • Measuring the transitions ne  nm is crucial for the future neutrino oscillation program. • With a conventional neutrino beam this means measuring nm → ne oscillations, and hence ne appearance. With a NF we can measure ne → nm oscillations & hence ne appearance → very low backgrounds

page.title:
Neutrino Factory R&D
Neutrino Factory R&D
page.enlisting:
•Neutrino Factory R&D pursued since 1997. • Since, in our present designs, the Neutrino Factory and Muon Collider have common front ends (up to & including the initial cooling channel), much of the R&D is in common. •See Bob Palmer’s Muon Collider talk for proton requirements, target, bunching & phase rotation, and cooling design and R&D. • Key experiments:

page.title:
Targetry
Targetry
page.normal_text:
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 17
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 17
page.enlisting:
• Need proton beam power of 4MW & short bunches (3ns) • Optimum proton beam energy = 10 ± 5 GeV (ISS study) but at fixed power muon yield drops slowly with energy - lose ~30% for E=120 GeV (Mokhov) • A 4MW target station design study was part of “Neutrino Factory Study 1” in 2000 → ORNL/TM2001/124 • Facility studied was 49m long = target hall & decay channel, shielding, solenoids, remote handling & target systems. • Target: liquid Hg jet inside 20T solenoid, identified as one of the main Neutrino Factory challenges requiring proof-of- principle demonstration. • Need proton beam power of 4MW & short bunches (3ns)
• Need proton beam power of 4MW & short bunches (3ns) • N e e d

(  3 n s )

The MERIT Experiment at CERN
The MERIT Experiment at CERN

page.title:
FINAL REMARKS
FINAL REMARKS
page.enlisting:
•International Scoping Study prepared the way for the next step – The International Design Study •The IDS aspires to deliver a NF Reference Design Report (RDR) by 2012. • If the community wishes, after a few more years of preconstruction R&D, neutrino factory construction could begin as early as the late 2010’s • The NF & MC front-ends are, in present designs, the same … and require a 4MW (or more) proton source providing 3ns long (or less) bunches with a rep rate of a few x 10Hz. We believe we have the target technology for this. • Realizing a NF would mitigate many of the technical risks associated with realizing a MC
